config.question: What did Thomas Reade Cobb mean when he wrote “a state of bondage, so far from doing violence to the law of [the African’s] nature, develops and perfects it”?

choices.content: Servitude was good for African Americans.
Slaves had a right to freedom.
Slaves were physically weaker than whites.
Africans were gifted with amazing talents by nature.

answer_3.response: Paternalism went hand in hand with racism. In a typical proslavery apology, Georgia lawyer Thomas Reade Cobb wrote that “a state of bondage, so far from doing violence to the law of [the African’s] nature, develops and perfects it; and that, in that state, he enjoys the greatest amount of happiness, and arrives at the greatest degree of perfection of which his nature is capable.” The supposed mental and moral inferiority of Africans justified slavery.
